title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for x = 1, x = 3

1 point is earned for the reason

x = 1 and x = 3 because the graph of f' changes from increasing to decreasing at x = 1, and changes from decreasing to increasing at x = 3.
descriptions:
The student response earns none of the following points:

1 point is earned for x = 1, x = 3

1 point is earned for the reason

x = 1 and x = 3 because the graph of f' changes from increasing to decreasing at x = 1, and changes from decreasing to increasing at x = 3.

The student response earns all of the following points:

x = 1 and x = 3 because the graph of f' changes from increasing to decreasing at x = 1, and changes from decreasing to increasing at x = 3.

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for indicating f decreases then increases

1 point is earned for eliminating x = 5 for maximum

1 point is earned for absolute minimum at x = 4

1 point is earned for absolute maximum at x = -1

The function f decreases from x = -1 to x = 4, then increases from x = 4 to x = 5.

Therefore, the absolute minimum value for f is at x = 4. The absolute maximum value must occur at x = -1 or at x = 5.

f(5)−f(−1)= ∫ −1 5 f ′ (t)dt <0 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4A7A@

Since f(5) < f(-1), the absolute maximum value occurs at x = -1.

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
2 points are earned for g'(x)

1 point is earned for the tangent line

g'(x) = f(x) + xf'(x)

g'(2) = f(2) + 2f'(2) = 6 + 2(-1) = 4

g(2) = 2f(2) = 12

Tangent line is y = 4(x - 2) + 12
descriptions:
The student response earns none of the following points:

2 points are earned for g'(x)

1 point is earned for the tangent line

g'(x) = f(x) + xf'(x)

g'(2) = f(2) + 2f'(2) = 6 + 2(-1) = 4

g(2) = 2f(2) = 12

Tangent line is y = 4(x - 2) + 12
